groups.title: Introduction
groups.description:
Arise, Sire! Your time has come!
By means unknown, you have risen to the grand position of Dark Lord.
Your goal is to conquer and corrupt, to extend your influence over all that you survey in defiance of any current rulers. You are not called to do so by any higher power or ancient geas. It is simply your nature. Malice runs in your veins, and cruelty has become your birthright.
Much of your power is committed to the essentials of your new role, but you retain a fraction of it to apportion as you please.
Each section below will come with a number of free choices that you must use. You have 7 Loose Sparks of Power which you can use to purchase boons from any section, and must finish this document with zero (0) or more.
The following three boons are yours by default.
LONG MAY YOU REIGN.

groups.title: Default Boons
groups.description: These powers are inherent to your nature as a Dark Lord.

items.title: Immortality
items.description:
Evil never truly dies.
Age and Illness have no power over you. If your mortal form is somehow slain, you will reform yourself some time within the next 100 years. If your spirit is sealed away, you will be freed within 1000 years.
If you are banished from a world, you will be reborn on another within 50 years.

items.title: Corruption
items.description:
Bend all to your will.
By establishing dominance over a person, place, or thing you can magically bend it to your will.
Holy weapons become perverted to darkness, brave heroes become slaves to your will, and even the land itself twists to suit your needs... if you can break down your target's resistance, that is.

items.title: Expansion
items.description:
Nothing is beyond your reach.
Your awakening coincides with you falling between worlds. Perhaps one caused the other, but you cannot say. You can use this CYOA in conjunction with any CYOA that takes you to a new world. You also gain access to a lengthy and expensive ritual to open permanent gateways to other worlds.

groups.title: Form
groups.description: Your physical body is unmade and remade by the dark powers in your veins. The exact cosmetics of your new form will be up to your discretion, but now is the time to decide the nature of your new existence. You have one (1) free Form choice. By purchasing a second one, you may choose to either blend your forms together to average their advantages and disadvantages or have the ability to switch between them. If you gain access to another CYOA-granted alteration of your form, you can choose to either discard that selection entirely or apply the benefits and drawbacks of Overpowering or Glamorous to it. You may not take Ephemeral with another body alteration in this way.

items.title: Overpowering
items.description:
You will be a juggernaut.
You focus on raw power. Your new form will be mighty beyond reckoning, possessing the speed, strength, and endurance of ten men. Your skin will turn many mortal weapons, and your senses will be as sharp as knives. Take care, as your sheer might will hint at your nature to all who see you.

items.title: Glamorous
items.description:
You will be beautiful and perfect.
You focus on appeal and elegance. This will grant you preternatural beauty, open the ears of many to your words, and allow you to more readily conceal your nature when you venture out into the world. However, such guile has a cost. Your physical might will only be twice that of a mortal man's.

items.title: Ephemeral
items.description:
Why form a body at all?
You become a shadow on the wall, a wisp of smoke on the wind. Such a formless being could only be slain by acts of great magic, and your stealth will be peerless... but exerting more than the faintest force will require focus, and your strength will compare unfavorably to stronger mortals.

groups.title: Progeny
groups.description:
As a Dark Lord- or Lady, I suppose, your choices are your own on that front- it is only to be expected that you will have a great brood of children through whatever methods you find appropriate. What is a Dark Lord without a harem of conquered princesses and heroines to lounge around your throne in chains, after all?
By default your magical nature allows you to breed with anything as long as one of you is getting seed in the other's womb, but the result of those unions is up to you to decide. You have ONE (1) free Progeny choice from the options below. If you purchase another, you are able to decide what percentage of your children will be of each type you purchased, and will know dark rituals to shape individual pregnancies to your will.

items.title: Monsters
items.description: Alas, your unfortunate offspring! Your Dark powers produce monstrous progeny with their very beings warped by the fell energies, their intellects to be crippled and their bodies deformed. Such progeny are undeniably mighty and remain unfailingly loyal to you, but their wretched existences lead to short lives. You gain one (1) Loose Spark of Power.

items.title: Minions
items.description: Your children will be members of your horde, their exact race selected randomly from among the Minion choices available to you. Your direct offspring will tend to be well above average for their species, though they may also be more independent. You know dark rituals that allow you to influence which of the Minions available your children will become.

items.title: Masters
items.description: These children are perhaps the most 'natural' kind, coming out with a mixture of their parents' traits. Their fragments of your own dark powers and the ability to command your minions in your stead make for fine lieutenants, but take care. For while they bear an instinctive loyalty to you... they also have shadows of your own darker nature. And instinct can be overridden.

groups.title: Lair
groups.description: A being of your power and nature demands a seat for that power, a territory to call your own. Your Lair sits at the heart of your Domain, a fortress from which you can rule your lands with an iron fist. Your starting lair comes with a small cache of dark lore with which to research new expressions of your powers, the magical fonts from which your starting Minions are born, and a dungeon in which to house and break captives. Further details are decided below. You have one (1) free Lair choice from the options below. If you buy more than one, it is up to you to decide whether they should be melded together or distantly connected by hidden tunnels.

items.title: Catacombs
items.description: A warren of tunnels and caverns and crevasses. Is your lair the catacombs of some great city, or a long-abandoned mine? Perhaps you have claimed and finished a natural cave formation, or even an old and forgotten dungeon in the wilderness. Only a bit cramped and extremely covert... as long as you stay inside. Of course, food will have to be acquired somehow...

items.title: Tower
items.description: Akin to a foreboding tower on a lonely mountaintop, befitting a master wizard. Deeply secluded, with a good swathe of terrain at its command... but somewhat inconvenient to move to and from, and food supply will be an issue you need to address early. This choice includes a large cache of useful lore, granting a 50% boost to Research speed for your first 12 points.

items.title: Castle
items.description: A dark fortress commanding a large chunk of territory of your choosing. Do you want blasted plains, haunted forests, or icy peaks? Perhaps an abandoned, damned city is more to your liking? The region will be inhabited only sparsely by intelligent beings, and somewhat more thickly by wild monsters. You will have plenty of room to expand, though it is less than subtle.

items.title: Manor
items.description: A prestigious, foreboding estate. It may be in the heart of a major city, or it may be somewhat more... secluded, but either way your lair will scream of flaunted wealth and an austere disposition. An excellent place from which to begin worming your way into high society... but a highly visible and ill-defensible one. Your Minions will need to be very, very careful.

items.title: Dread Vessel
items.description: A ghost ship, a flying castle, perhaps even a space hulk. Whether it sails the seas, skies, or stars will depend on the world you journey to. Your vessel will be a massive and imposing one by the local standards, able to command the local terrain decisively. The advantages of mobility are of course countless, though expansion will eventually require ship-building.

items.title: Underworld
items.description: A small demiplane of your very own, accessed through magical doorways you can open on any flat surface. Small runestones can be made to allow minions to come and go on their missions without your direct management, but be warned- anyone can use them. Eminently defensible and flexible but also the smallest option, and demiplanes are difficult to expand.

groups.title: Magics
groups.description: What would a Dark Lord be without their own personal, overwhelming power? Quickly dead, most often. You are more than capable of mastering any local system of magic you put your mind to studying, but for now you must decide which Dark Magics to imprint on your being to start with. You have THREE (3) free MAGIC choices, and any magic you acquire here will come to you with terrifying (for your opponents) ease. You can unlock more magics by completing Research. Three full working months of intensive study from you grants one (1) Research point. Unlocking a new Dark Magic, of which the ones shown here are only examples, costs sixteen (16) Research points.

items.title: Fire
items.description: Sweltering heat and plumes of ash accompany torrents of fire that rise at your command. Pyromancy is the element of offense, raw and unrelenting. You can certainly grant such boons as resistance to heat, but your greatest tool for defending against physical attack is incinerating your enemies before they swing their sword at your head.

items.title: Ice
items.description: Winter winds howl and hoarfrost climbs along every surface as sheets of ice and snow obey your command. Cryomancy is a mixed defensive and offensive element. It tends to struggle defending against fire and blunt impact, but it is more than made up for by the ability to let your armies ignore blizzards... or call them on your foes.

items.title: Thunder
items.description: The heavens roar and split, sending gales of wind and bolts of lightning down at a flick of your wrist. Thunder is another powerfully offensive element, allowing for both bludgeoning wind and piercing electricity. It has somewhat less raw destructive power than fire, but controlling storms and wind can be an excellent strategic power all on its own.

items.title: Earth
items.description: Stone cracks and mud flows like a river at your command. Geomancy is a powerfully defensive element overall with relatively slow attacks, but when its attacks land they carry immense force. Especially noteworthy is its power as a siege weapon- rare is the nonmagical fortresses that can survive the very earth beneath the walls turning against it.

items.title: Nature
items.description: Branches strike like whips and roots rise from the ground like grasping claws at a snap of your fingers. Naturomancy is a flexible utility element, allowing you to manipulate flora to attack and starve your enemies. Almost more useful is having it grow more produce for your own troops. You can also communicate with and command animals, though not warp them.

items.title: Darkness
items.description: Shadows twist and writhe, forming skeletal hands and spider-like claws as you desire. Umbramancy is an all-rounder of an element, attacking with spectral cold or tearing claws of shadow. You can even transport yourself and others through shadows, making for an excellent infiltration element.

items.title: Fleshcrafting
items.description: Flesh warps, bone bubbles, and the bodies of friend and foe alike change to your designs. Biomancy is a slow but potent utility element, allowing you to apply gruesome augmentations to existing creatures or piece together all new ones from parts. Sadly it does not allow for the creation of plagues or other micro-organisms, but goblins are a plague in themselves.

items.title: Artifice
items.description: Gears groan and shriek as you craft a new, terrible future for the world. Artifice is the art of creating magical items and devices, ranging from enchanted swords to autonomous siege engines. The primary limitations will be your industry and the ability of your minions to craft your designs, but be wary: that which you create is not bound to be loyal as Minions are.

items.title: Ebonsteel
items.description: A magical metal to compare to Mithril or Adamantine flows from your fingertips. Ebonsteel is a uniquely useful and biddable metal to you and your forces, and this magic allows you to create it from nothing to serve your needs. Ebonsteel armor and weapons are among the finest in all creation... if you donâ€™t mind how they seduce the user to your will.

groups.title: Artifacts
groups.description: Similarly, where would a Dark Lord be without their dread artifacts? Don't worry, they only curse people who take them from you. If lost, Dark Artifacts can be magically summoned to your side once per year. They can be gifted- temporarily or otherwise- to chosen servants if you so desire, allowing them the full benefits of their use. More Dark Artifacts can be made by either corrupting an existing Artifact with your innate power of Corruption or crafting a worthy item with your own hands. Only the greatest items can be declared artifacts. You have THREE (3) free ARTIFACT choices.

items.title: Devastation
items.description: An indestructible, shape-shifting ebonsteel weapon that strikes with unnatural force and speed. As you first pick it up Devastation chooses three forms to take. Swapping between your weapon's forms is as easy as a flick of the wrist. Each form has a different role, but their use comes to you with unnatural ease and they all serve as a potent conduit for offensive magic.

items.title: Dread Aegis
items.description: An ebonsteel shield, black as night and emblazoned with a terrible visage. The Aegis is indestructible, and is able to reflect harmful magics that strike it if you have the knack. Gazing upon the terrible faces carved into the black steel strikes fear and doubt into the hearts of those that are not Dark Lords, potentially eroding their will to resist over time.

items.title: Armor of Shadows
items.description: A suit of magical, self-repairing ebonsteel armor that stows itself in your shadow when not in use. When worn the armor increases your speed, strength, and toughness five fold, and if it is broken it will reform in your shadow within five minutes. The magical properties of this armor mean that any damage you take while wearing it is halved, no matter how terrible the blow.

items.title: Staff of Ruin
items.description: An indestructible ebonsteel staff. When used as a focus, its dark power harmonize with your own, granting you greatly increased magical power when using it. With this staff, your magical assaults will go from terrifying to godly in strength. The magical energies will also grant you insight into magical research, allowing you to earn research points 10% faster.

items.title: Orb of Mists
items.description: An indestructible crystalline sphere filled with swirling smoke and fog. When properly installed in your stronghold it augments your dark powers with an additional well of magical power to call upon from any distance. Pondering its depths can reveal secrets of magic to you, allowing you to earn research points 20% faster.

items.title: Book of Secrets
items.description: A leather-bound tome that crackles with eldritch power. If damaged, it will revert to a pristine state the moment it is not observed. It contains many dark and terrible secrets, allowing you to earn research points 30% faster. Its first pages contain a ritual that allows you to transfer the contents of any information storage to its pages, which never seem to run out.

items.title: Blood Pact Quill
items.description: An indestructible spined quill that digs cruel thorns into the hand of any who write with it. The quill steals the blood- or nearest equivalent- of the writer for ink, and those who write with the Quill other than yourself can only write the truth. A contract signed in blood with the Quill cannot be broken unless by your decree.

items.title: Mirror of Many Things
items.description: An ornate mirror that shows an empty blackness instead of a reflection. You can use the mirror to scry any place you have seen, and can freely move the mirror's viewpoint to scout new and familiar lands from a bird's eye view. Once every month you can ask the mirror to find something, and it will never fail to find the object of your curiosity.

items.title: Crown of Whispers
items.description: An indestructible ebonsteel crown. This artifact gives you power over the mind- letting you hear the whispers of their thoughts, and whisper your own back. This grants telepathic communication for those within a thousand feet and, if you are subtle, the ability to manipulate minds not sharp enough to notice which thoughts are their own.

groups.title: Minions Intro
groups.description:
You may have finished your decisions regarding your own Lordly being, but even a Dark Lord can hardly be called a lord at all without someone to lord over. You have SEVEN (7) SPARKS OF POWER for Minion choices.

You can only purchase a MINION if you have purchased a Minion of the same color type of the tier below. Each Minion choice costs as much as its tier- so Tier IV minions cost 4 Sparks, Tier III cost 3, and so on.

Minions are loyal to you, but prone to infighting and power-plays against each other. They can breed with anything intelligent, and have different reproduction rates to describe how long it takes to go from impregnation to working adult.

Your Lair will contain a font for each Minion type you have. Fonts produce Minions at a rate of a handful per day, but only up to a certain threshold. Those thresholds are: 24 for Tier I, 12 for Tier II, 6 for Tier III, and 3 for Tier IV. You start with half this many of each Minion type you have.

items.title: Tier I: Goblins
items.description: Goblins are dumb labor and expendable front-line troops, relying on reckless savagery, treachery, and raw numbers over discipline or skill. They are smaller and slightly frailer than most humans, standing between three and four feet tall on average. Their morale in combat is poor if they are forced to stab people in the front, and their sole saving grace is that they care so little for each other that combat losses do not hurt their morale. Goblins reproduce at a Fast rate, and tend to have more males than females.

items.title: Tier I: Kobolds
items.description: Kobolds are craftsmen and inventors, relying more on low cunning, rickety traps, and competent tactics than physicality or will. They are smaller and frailer than most humans, coming between two and four feet tall on average. Their morale in combat is pitiful unless they have the advantage of numbers. Their draconic blood gives them resistance to heat, and they have a knack for metalworking. Kobolds reproduce at a Fast rate with part of this time spent as eggs, and tend to have a few more males than females.

items.title: Tier I: Imps
items.description: Imps are enchanters and ritualists, relying on crude mind magics, sparks of flame, and raw cruelty to compensate for their shortcomings and constant infighting. They are small and frail beings, ranging from two to three feet in height on average. Their morale is mediocre in small numbers, but imps are so prone to backstabbing that it grows ever more tenuous as their numbers grow. They have some knowledge of curses and rituals relating to inducing lust or fear in targets. Imps reproduce at a Fast rate, and tend to have many more males than females.

items.title: Tier I: Pixies
items.description: Pixies are scouts and diplomats who are uniformly beautiful, petty, vain, cruel creatures. Their physical abilities are unimpressive as they range from two to three feet tall, but they do possess weak illusions and the gift of flight. Pixies have pitiful morale in combat, unless insulted, but enraged pixies fight with berserk abandon. If they cannot lash out at the target of their ire immediately, they will attempt to plan a clever revenge... that is never as subtle as they think it is. Pixies reproduce at a Moderate rate, and tend to have more females than males.

items.title: Tier I: Ratmen
items.description: Ratmen are sneaks and murderers by default, favoring overwhelming numbers and surprise over individual ability or actual cooperation. Their physicality is notably less than most humans, as they average three feet in height. In battle their morale is terrible, but the adage about cornered rats holds quite true and they are gleefully aggressive when catching foes by surprise. They are able to glean simple things about the area from common rats. Their greatest advantage is that they reproduce Very Fast, and tend to have many more males than females.

items.title: Tier II: Orcs
items.description: The larger cousins of goblins are still dumb labor, but they make for much more powerful frontline troops that rely on brutish ferocity and thuggish strength to make up for their dim wits. Orcs are more powerful but not faster than most humans, averaging seven feet in height and burly. It requires a dire situation to make an orc flee a battle, as their minds are simple and rarely think beyond the next feast, fight, or fuck. Orcs reproduce at a Moderate rate, trending on the faster side, and have more males than females.

items.title: Tier II: Dragonborn
items.description: Dragonborn possess less of a talent for invention than kobolds, but make up for it with physical excellence and iron wills. They are slightly stronger and faster than most humans at an average between six and seven feet in height, possess a deadly breath weapon, and are notably tougher than most from their hard scales. Their morale and skill in combat are both excellent, dragon-born make for fearsome elite warriors. Dragonborn reproduce at a Moderate rate trending on the slower side, and have as many males as females.

items.title: Tier II: Succubi
items.description: Succubi- or Incubi, there is no real difference- are the witches of demonic forces. They range from four to seven feet in height and though their supernatural bodies make them slightly stronger than most mortals they are ill-suited and ill-tempered for true combat. Their magical talents run deeper than an imp's, focusing heavily on curses, enchantments, and rituals associated with lust, fertility, and inhibitions. Succubi grant you a 5% increase to Research Speed. These demons reproduce at a Moderate rate, and have as many males and hermaphrodites as females.

items.title: Tier II: Dryads
items.description: Dryads are spirits of nature, specifically of plants. Reckless deforestation upsets them greatly... but they see no issue in returning the favor by turning meat life into seedbeds or fertilizer. Physically they are little stronger or larger than a human, but they possess a variety of potent magics relating to growing and manipulating plant life. They are able to grow a wide range of useful crops and can provide everything from staple foods to exotic poisons with good soil. Dryads grant a 5% increase to Research Speed. They reproduce at a Moderate rate, and tend to be hermaphrodites.

items.title: Tier II: Gnolls
items.description: Gnolls are savage berserkers, more reckless in battle than even orcs but capable of inflicting far more damage in the depths of their bloodlust. Gnolls tend to slink away from entering combat with forces they cannot defeat while their wits are about them, but once combat is joined they are more likely to ignore orders to retreat than flee. Female gnolls tend to lead packs, being larger and stronger than males, but on average the species is not too dissimilar from humans. Gnolls reproduce at a Fast rate, and have slightly more males than females.

items.title: Tier III: Trolls
items.description: Trolls are lumbering, dimwitted brutes that possess exceptional strength, great endurance, and legendary healing abilities. Trolls average ten feet tall and can regrow their entire bodies over the course of a fortnight if decapitated and somehow kept alive, but they cannot increase their numbers through this healing. Burning or melting their flesh stops it from regenerating. Their morale is usually high in combat because they are too dull to recognize danger, but they break quickly when faced with fire or acid. Trolls reproduce at a Slow rate, and have many more males than females.

items.title: Tier III: Ogredrakes
items.description: Ogredrakes are mighty dragonblooded that yet posses much of their cousins' intellects. They average eleven feet tall and have thick, armored hides that resist much damage, putting them vastly beyond the abilities of most humans. Their morale is ironclad in combat and they are deceptively quick and skilled with their immense weapons. Their breath weapons are strong than those of a Dragonborn, able to catch a dozen men alight in the right circumstances. They reproduce at a Slow rate trending very slow, though part of this time is spent in eggs. They are mostly male.

items.title: Tier III: Shadow Demons
items.description: Shadow Demons are malevolent masses of darkness and bone used as shock troops by demonic forces. They average ten feet tall and have thick fur that dampens most elemental attacks, making them far more dangerous than most humans. Their morale is excellent, but they are relatively brutish and single-minded beings, making them ill suited to advanced tactics. They also struggle with fine tool use as their clawed hands, while wickedly sharp and dangerous, are not well suited to fine dexterity. They reproduce at a Slow rate, and are almost all male.

items.title: Tier III: Wild Hunters
items.description: Heavy cavalry and light scout all in one, members of the Wild Hunt are powerful shapechangers. They are able to shift between a massive humanoid nearing eight feet in height and an even larger moose, approaching nine feet at the shoulder. They can mix traits freely between forms, and often travel as fearsome centaurs or satyrs to reflect their blended nature. They are boisterous, bold, and powerful combatants, though they are often far more interested in hunting or showing off than true battle. They reproduce at a Slow rate and are evenly split between male and female.

items.title: Tier III: Minotaurs
items.description: Minotaurs are renowned for their power as they are their terrible rage. They stand between eight and ten feet tall, making them far stronger and tougher than most humans. In combat they easily fall into berserk rages with their oversized great weapons, and it is rare indeed for minotaurs to turn away from a fight... even when it might be wise. They also happen to possess a keen mind for mazes and all sorts of navigation, making them deceptively useful scouts and sailors. They reproduce at a Moderate rate, and have more males than females.

items.title: Tier IV: Giants
items.description: The archetypal hulking, lumbering brute, Giants are living siege engines and heavy dumb labor for your army. Standing nearly twenty feet tall and able to chuck boulders like toys, a giant is well beyond the abilities of most mortals to fight. They tend to be smarter than trolls, though not quite as much as goblins or men, and in combat their morale is strong. Astoundingly they know a primitive sort of magic, having instinctive knowledge of a handful of runes with weak warding and protective effects. Giants reproduce at a Very Slow rate, and have somewhat more males than females.

items.title: Tier IV: Dragons
items.description: Unparalleled masters of the sky, Dragons are a versatile and deadly force of nature on the battlefield. Adult dragons are at least twenty feet long, and they grow up to one hundred feet over the course of their first century. Their iron-hard scales, sword-like claws, and potent breath weapons make them a deadly threat to a normal human. Their intelligence is at least equal to a human, and their fabled arrogance leads to exceptional morale- few things can frighten a dragon. Dragons reproduce Very Slowly via eggs, taking more time to breed than most any other, and are mostly male.

items.title: Tier IV: Pit Lords
items.description: Pit Lords are the generals and juggernauts of demonic forces, wielding fiery weaponry and soaring on wings of ash. They tower up to sixteen feet tall and favor ebonsteel armor and weapons, making them specters of death to normal humans. There is very little that can make a pit lord feel fear, though if truly threatened they are more inclined to retreat and regroup than fight to the death. They have some skill with the curses and rituals used by their underlings, though they prefer to use their terrible might in most battles. They reproduce at a Very Slow rate, and are almost all male.

items.title: Tier IV: Ladies
items.description: Ladies- and Lords, rarely- are the magical rulers and mages of fey beings. They stand between five and eight feet tall and are uncannily beautiful, but their magical nature makes them nearly twice as strong and far faster than any normal man. They are fearsome and arrogant combatants with respectable morale, but their primary skill is in their command of magic relating to nature, illusions, dreams, bewitchment, and transformation. They grant a 20% increase to Research Speed with their knowledge of magic. They reproduce at a Very Slow rate, and are almost all female or hermaphrodites.

items.title: Tier IV: Giant Apes
items.description: Titanic beasts resembling massive gorillas or chimpanzees, giant apes are living siege weapons for beastmen hordes. Standing fifteen feet tall on their back legs and strong enough to batter a stone wall down with their fists, they can easily crush any normal human. They are barely intelligent and prone to fits of berserk rage if harmed, making them powerful but difficult to control weapons. Their exceptional climbing ability allows them to scale obstacles that might stymie a giant or minotaur to attack those within. They reproduce at a Slow rate, and have more males than females.

groups.title: Alternate Minions
groups.description: Here you can purchase a variety of alternate Minion types, either in addition to or instead of the Minion types with the same tier and color type above. These Minions satisfy the requirements to buy higher tiers of their color type.

items.title: Tier II: Dire Wolves
items.description: Monstrous wolves that serve as hunting dogs and steeds for goblins. At seven feet long and three feet tall they easily overpower unarmed humans, though weaponry can even the odds quickly. Being very smart beasts rather than intelligent beings, their morale in combat is poor unless bolstered by thinking allies. Despite not being able to speak they are smart enough to broadly follow commands, but not enough to read or write. They make serviceable beasts of burden, though they can be aggressive with their handlers. They reproduce at a Fast rate, trending slower, and are mostly male.

items.title: Tier II: Drakes
items.description: Drakes are large, bestial draconic creatures that serve as mounts and trackers for kobolds. They are eight feet long with the tail and nearly three feet tall, which in tandem with their hard scales makes them severe threats to humans. They are clever animals but little more, and can struggle with complex commands as a result. Their morale is decent, but benefits from being bolstered by intelligent allies. They are often used as beasts of burden, but can be stubborn when their handlers are small creatures. They reproduce at a Moderate rate, trending faster, and are mostly male.

items.title: Tier I: Hellhounds
items.description: Feral hounds of hell commonly used as trackers by demonic forces, hellhounds take the form of moderately sized canines with burning eyes. Dangerous to an unarmed human, but readily overcome with weaponry. Their morale in combat is poor and their intelligence no more or less than clever and cruel-minded hounds. They make for poor beasts of burden due to their relatively small size and ill tempers. Notably they are highly resistant to fire and high temperatures, making them good at navigating deserts, jungles, and hells. They reproduce at a Fast rate, and are mostly male.

items.title: Tier I: Brownies
items.description: Brownies are fey workmen and servants, serving as logistics and maintenance. Brownies stand between two and three feet tall, and are notably feebler than most humans. They are extremely stealthy and hard-working creatures, busily working to clean and repair your possessions. They have a small pool of magics dedicated to such tasks. Their morale in a fight is utterly pitiful. Brownies often refuse to do violence at all unless their target has invaded a place they call home, and even then they are clumsy fighters. They reproduce at a Fast rate, and are evenly male and female.

items.title: Tier I: Yinglets
items.description: Scurrying, long-limbed creatures, Yinglets are the teeming masses of beastmen forces. They come between two and four feet in height but are very fragile, making them pitiful combatants. Their morale is similarly poor. Yinglets can be savage when desperate, but even armed they are easily killed by humans and they know it. Their one advantage is that they are ludicrously numerous. They are also somewhat apt at scavenging, primarily because of their numbers. Yinglets reproduce at a Blisteringly Fast pace, and are almost all male. Females are revered in Yinglet society due to their rarity.

items.title: Tier III: Giant Bats
items.description: Enormous bats large enough to carry a pair of orcs or a pack of goblins into battle and serving as the aerial transport and firing platform of such forces. Giant bats are nearly ten feet long and have vast wingspans, making them highly dangerous to normal humans. Their morale is respectable for a tamed beast, and they will typically only panic if they face a greater threat in the air... or if their riders do. Their echolocation makes them excellent for navigating and working at night. They reproduce at a Slow rate, and have more males than females.

items.title: Tier III: Wyverns
items.description: Savage two-legged fliers, wyverns are mounts for the aerial cavalry of draconic forces. They are nearly twelve feet long, making them large and strong enough to carry a fully armored dragonborn or a pack of kobolds into battle on their backs and more than capable of ripping through most humans in groups. Their morale is high, especially for barely intelligent beasts. Their breath weapon is a spray of toxic acid that can blind and disorient opponents, and they have sharp tail stingers. They reproduce at a Slow rate, and have more males than females.

items.title: Tier II: War Demons
items.description: War demons are the screaming hordes of demonic forces, serving as front-line troops of brutal strength and skill. They are taller than humans on average and notably stronger and more durable. Their morale in combat is excellent, but their glorification of combat and bloodshed means that they will often descend into blind blood rages. They possess great resistance to fire and the ability to hurl gouts of flame from their hands, along with goat-like hooves that grant them great stability on tricky terrain. They reproduce at a Moderate rate, and are almost all male.

items.title: Tier II: Nereids
items.description: Nereids are beautiful sea nymphs, capable of aiding both transportation and combat across the high seas. They are roughly the size of a human and only slightly stronger, but possess a variety of magic related to creating and controlling water along with the obvious abilities to breath underwater and swim at incredible speeds. They can also communicate with sea life, making them excellent fisherfey. Their morale in combat is mediocre, but as long as they stay at range or in the water they hold up well enough. They reproduce at a Moderate rate, and are mostly hermaphrodites and females.

items.title: Tier II: Harpies
items.description: Harpies are winged humanoids that serve as skirmishers and scouts for beastmen, with flighty and distract-able personalities. They are a little smaller than humans on average, but strong enough to carry one away in their talons in a pinch. Their morale in combat is relatively weak. They struggle to use weapons or wear armor while flying, but they are very apt at dropping projectiles on opponents from above and take glee in doing so as long as they're not being shot at. They reproduce at a Fast rate and are an even mix of males, hermaphrodites, and females.
